autoPause_Initial_Nolist_SecondLine.message: Check back after you've browsed the web.

autoPause_Initial_SubTitle.message: We'll stop videos from playing automatically on websites.

autoPause_Table_Header_DataSaved_Message.message: * Saved data is estimated based on video size.

autoPause_Whitelist_Button_StopAutoPlay.message: Stop auto-play videos on this site

autoPause_Whitelisted_Title.message: Videos will auto-play on this site

ext_Description.message: Stop videos from auto-playing and slowing down your web-browsing

faq_Answer_1.message: Anyone who wants to save data, speed up web-browsing, and stop annoying auto-playing videos.

faq_Answer_2.message: Web Boost is a Chrome extension that needs to be turned on so it can help speed up your browsing.

faq_Answer_3.message: Web Boost stops auto-playing videos even if the video audio is muted. It also makes it easy for you to personalize your settings if you want to see auto-playing videos on some websites. The Chrome feature can be difficult to turn on, it can't pause an auto-playing video that has muted audio, and it doesn't let you personalize settings outside of Chrome's Media Engagement Index (MEI).

faq_Answer_4.message: Based on the size of the embedded video–the bigger the size, the higher the estimate of data savings. Sometimes we're so fast at stopping videos from auto-playing that we can't determine the amount of data saved. When this happens, we'll show 'No info'.

faq_Question_2.message: Why should I keep Web Boost turned on?

faq_Question_3.message: How is Web Boost different from Google Chrome auto-play support?

faq_Question_4.message: How are my data savings estimated?

whiteList_Remove_Success_Message.message: has been removed from your whitelist

whiteList_Url_Listing_title.message: Allow auto-playing videos on these websites

whitelist_Toggle_Text.message: Turn on to stop auto-playing videos on websites
